Job Title: Senior Accountant

Location: Foxborough (Foxboro), MA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Senior Accountant Role with Connect Pay LLC
Company Background
 Connect Pay LLC is a high growth SaaS/Technology enabled service enabled payroll provider focused on serving small businesses across the United States with presence in 12 office locations.
Position overview. 
 Connect Pay is searching for a highly motivated, resourceful, technical thinker to join our growing Company. The Senior accountant will be a key member of the accounting and finance team and will provide support across the entire organization. In addition to general ledger and month end financial close responsibilities, the Senior Accountant will assist with internal and external financial reporting, system enhancements and implementations, treasury, and capital raising initiatives. The position will also partner with FP&A in ad hoc projects and analysis. The individual should be excited to join a high growth company, thrive in establishing and improving processes and controls, and enjoy mentoring other members of the accounting team. 

Roles and Responsibilities
Monthly ClosePrepare and analyze balance sheet account reconciliations and journal entries for monthly close.Partner with engineering (R&D) in quantifying and posting internal labor capitalization costs. Partner with recently acquired companies to map financials into ConnectPay’s master chart of accounts.Meet objective of closing the books in 8 business days.Complete monthly flux analysis for P&L and B.S.Prepare and publish timely, accurate monthly financial statements.
Process ImprovementOwn/overhaul/optimize the sales commission calculation and payment process.Evaluate and implement ERP enhancements to optimize revenue and client fund data analytics.Implement purchasing and expense management system including developing delegation of authority matrix.Assess and recommend scalable process improvement opportunities to support ConnectPay’s growth trajectory.Assist in the implementation and maintenance of internal control procedures to safeguard company assets and ensure compliance with regulatory standards.Recommend necessary workflow improvements to drive monthly close process to 5 business days.Financial ReportingOwn the preparation of weekly cash forecast and provide recommendation for cash optimization opportunities.Prepare monthly Compliance Certificate and Borrowing Base Capacity schedules.
External Partner ManagementPartner with Controller in managing engagements (Annual audit, valuation, State tax filing, K1 Issuance). Respond to inquiries and requests for information from auditors, and other external stakeholders professionally and promptly.
Ad hoc/OtherCollaborate with Director of FP&A and assist in ad hoc projects which can include pricing, variance analysis of financial performance, product profitability, financial system enhancements and implementations.Ensure compliance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and other regulatory requirements.Assist in the consolidation and integration of newly acquired companies.
This position is based in Foxboro MA.
Benefits Package: As a ConnectPay team member, you will receive a competitive pay and benefits package designed to take care of your needs that includes base pay, incentives, paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance, company provided life and disability insurance, paid parental leave, 401K employer match (retirement savings) after 1 year of employment and a robust wellness program.
· BCBS Medical InsuranceBCBS Dental InsuranceCompany paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Insurance and Life InsuranceHealth Savings AccountFlexible Spending AccountVision InsuranceWellness Program401(k)401(k) matchingGenerous Managed PTOUnit Options EquityBonus program

Preferred QualificationsBachelor's degree (Major in Accounting) required, and CPA preferred.3 + years of experience in public accounting and/or audit roleStrong understanding of US GAAP, and ability to perform accounting guidance research.Demonstrated ability and willingness to drill-in to operational details while maintaining appropriate whole-company perspective.High level of flexibility, adaptability, and multi-tasking to meet deadlines.An ability to manage complex accounting and reporting systems and processes.Advanced knowledge of Excel, knowledge of automated financial and reporting systems,Ability to leverage technology and capable of learning new systems.Excitement in building the infrastructure of an accounting department.Willing to challenge the status quo.An entrepreneurial spirit - comfortable in a dynamic work environment and possess a proven ability to create operational efficiencies and streamline processes without direct oversight. You're a self-starter and thrive in an evolving, changing environment.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
